revised_title: Ophthalmoscopic Studies on Mammalian Eye Fundi
tldr: This study examines the fundi of fifty mammals' eyes through ophthalmoscopy, relating the appearances to the usual classification of mammals and discussing them with reference to habitat and some experimental observations of regional visual acuity. The research provides detailed descriptions and illustrations of the fundi of various mammals, including primates, rodents, and carnivores, highlighting the differences in their eye structures and visual characteristics.
